title: Lille lokalt craft marked, med håndlavede ting
text:
Lille lokalt marked, hvor man kan se dem lave de forskellige ting på gaden. Dette gør oplevelsen meget bedre.
Man behøves ikke guide med.
Husk ikke at betal den første pris de siger, men forhandle med dem i stedet 

Anbefaling herfra

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: sehenswert
text: Sehenswert aber recht teuer. Verhandeln ist zwar möglich, aber im Vergleich mit anderen Märkten empfanden wir die Preise recht hoch.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Gezellige markt
text:
Zeer vriendelijke mensen die hun koopwaar aan de man brengen. Ideaal om souveniertjes te kopen. Houtsnijwerk, stoffen, tassen, kleine hebbedingetjes.....teveel om op te noemen.
Beetje afdingen op de prijs wordt aangeraden maar als iets nu al zo weinig kost heb ik daar veel moeite mee en doe het niet overdreven.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: 1. Market  in Gambia
text:
Unser 1. Market  in Gambia .
Hier gibt es nicht viel zu sehen. 
Für Mitbringsel ganz ok.
Aber die Schule in der Nähe sollte man besuchen.
Es war schön die Freude in den Kinderaugen zu sehen. 
Und eine kleine Spende hilft.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Have a look
text: Same same really loads of different things to pick from the best part the hussle and getting the best price. You can see alot of work has gone into the crafting of the goods. Good gifts for home.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Very interesting
text: It’s always interesting to look around the craft market. Some lovely items to barter over. The only thing is that some of the stalls need to sell different things as many of them try and all sell the same.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: such relaxing place
text:
Baqau craft market. I go there and sit down with the people and jus relax. they are real nice people there like family. they don't get much business. so you will get very good deals on jewelry and clothes. the wooden statues hand made are amazing. but jus take your time. relax and offer reasonable offers. i was there today. an amazing bird statue quite large was 7000 dallasi. jus over 100 pound uk. a chinese man offered 700 dalassi. thats just insult. it took guy 2 weeks to make by hand. not some cheap chinese reproduction. but im sure he would taken around 5000 .. opposite is beautiful gardens to visit and behind is a Baqau community centre school you must visit and try give some donations.
there is one guy from uk has transformed that school. it was jus a dirty downtrodden shack. now look at it... it still needs glass windows that can fully open. the outside base needs cementing etc etc etc

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Good place to get gifts to take back home
text: The arts and craft market has a line of shops with paintings, wood and metal carvings crafts, african prints clothings shirts, dresses, wall batik paintings with various designs, fridge magnets, scarves that can be used as souvenirs. You will definitely have to haggle for prices, once they know you're a tourist they always add on 5 times the price so I'd advice if the craft man says 3000 dalasi price it down all the way to 500 till you get to a reasonable price. It is definitely a good place to buy art work but be ready to haggle!

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Si estas en la zona no te lo pierdas
text: Bakau es una pequeña población, para mi que me gusta la fotografia, muy interesante, es un puerto de pescadores que merece la pena visitar, en toda la carretera general al lado del citado puerto se encuentran dos mercados, el de artesania y el de pescados, frutas y verduras, a mi me encanta, pero habrá gente que no le gusten los olores y algo de suciedad que existe, pero...estamos en Africa amigos mios, Hay que vivirla.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Brilliant
text: Fantastic  place  to go to beautiful wooden  caving gorgeous . wish I could  buy lots and lots of things .it's brilliant  to just watch these  people  making  these cavings

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Craft Market
text: Local to Ngala Lodge Hotel, the goods here seem to be of a better quality than some of the other markets.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Real africa
text: Love all the colourful costumes the local women wear.locals a bit too pushy with tourists just be firm and walk away.a poor country but so many locals have mobile phones

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: A small  selection of shops selling locally made carvings and other craft wear
text:
This craft market is a small selection of approximately 25 lockup shops on the corner of Atlantic Boulevard and Old Cape Road going from the centre of Bakau to Cape Point. 

We found there is quite a selection of locally produced items for sale.  Some shops sell wood carvings where you can see the owners sitting outside making items. Others sell woven items and leather goods that are quite good quality and are reasonably priced if you willing to haggle.  Another of the shops on the corner is run by a gentleman who makes woven items and you can watch him at work on his basic weaving machine.  The items are of surprising good quality.

It is not a place to make a special journey for, but well worth looking round if you are in the local area.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Sightseeing
text: Roaming about and popping in to each shop in the craft market to see  and get what I want. Very nice environment, 2 minutes walk to the Bakau beach and to the local market where you get most of the nice fruits like mango, bananas, oranges and other legumes. At the beach side you can have a stroll with friends and eat fresh fish, if you want it grilled or cooked you can get it from the sea side.its a lovely place.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Love the craft market
text: I love visiting the craft market where you can actually see the goods on sale being made. The shop keepers are keen to show you around their shops and are willing to talk to you and explain how they do things & if you buy a drum be prepared for a lesson on it  - Always very interesting.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: A quality and relaxed market
text: An enjoyable market to visit where there is no hard sell and you are able to look around each stall in relative peace. Obviously need to barter a little on the price but good fun. A little walk down the road is where the fishing boats are based. If you are confident enough it is also worth looking around here and the fishermen are most obliging in showing you their work and catch of the day for a few Dalasi tip. It is an eye opener seeing where your Butterfish and Ladyfish come from.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Return visit
text: After visiting the country for over 30 years we always take school groups here. This safe, relaxed and authentic market offers value for money and some terrific souvenirs. Haggling is a must but all part of the experience. Any taxi driver will know where you need to go........Bakau.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Nice little market, perfect for souvenirs
text: We picked up three small sand art pictures at this shop as well as another few nice little gifts at the neighbouring stalls. The choice is not huge (wood carvings, paintings, textiles) but perfect if you are just looking for a few inexpensive gifts... While all the traders were extremely friendly and eager for us to buy, none of them were aggressively pushy and all of them kept smiling even when we didn't buy from their stalls. A lovely retail experience!

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Good example
text: They have some really good work here. I bought some very good African paintings here, though I did have to barter for them. All the shops here are worth a look and see some of the locals doing the wood carving too. Great place for all types of gifts and all tastes.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: 岬に行くまでのこじんまりしたとこ
text: 岬にいく途中に見つけたこじんまりしたとこやけど、まぁ、クオリティ高いんかなぁ。その手前の角んとこの方が品揃えはええけど。

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Excellent
text: They made me a Zebra so happy with it the quality of craft work here is of avert high standard definitely worth a visit

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: One of the best
text:
I like this market because there is less hassle than some of the others in Gambia. You can see the things being made. Men with a chunk of wood between their feet hammering away and some of the things they make are amazing.
If you want to buy then be prepared to haggle for a good price. Great fun.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Well worth a visit
text: The craftmanship put into the figures are outstanding true Gambia products. Very busy market and plenty of stalls to visit and gifts for home and very reasonable priced. Get yourself a local guide for these markets to stop getting hassled. Good and pleasant exsperience.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Best Market in the country
text: I have visited the country several times and have yet to discover another market to equal this one.  The stall holders are friendly and in most cases low pressure, just come and look.  I buy most of my souvenirs here as I am given time to look.  I have had several wood articles carved at the market for me.  If the object wasn't done correct it is either fixed or another is carved.  Special items made usually take a couple of days.  There are a couple of market holders that will sell you items (especially cloth) that may not be the correct size for the price of a proper size so you do need to beware, but over all I found this market to be an excellent place to shop.  Please remember that even though the wood is from The Gambia most items are carved by the Senegalese.  I have some amazing pieces of work at home from the market ought at reasonable prices.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Pleasant shopping
text:
I went early, about 9am as the little shops were opening. It was quiet and cool at this time. There was no pressure to buy, but encouragement to look inside each shop - not onerous. The quality of goods is reasonable. Don't expect amazing works of art, but I bought a couple of lovely wraps/sarongs to wear on the beach, which were prettier and as good quality as anything I have seen in the UK. As others have said, bargaining is expected. No idea if I got a good price for the few things I bought, but I paid no more than the things were worth to me. 

At the left of the market as you face it, is a small cafe which doesn't look anything but has a reliable and reasonably clean loo - handy if you have tummy trouble.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Low pressure market
text: After the hassle of Albert Market in Banjul - Bakau was a delight.  Friendly un-pressured stall holders meant we could browse and find things we wanted.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Slightly out of the ordinary
text: So many African craft markets are carbon copies of each other, and the items for sale differ little. This shop is enough out of the ordinary to make the effort to visit. Very little hassle from locals.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Africa
text: Hier worden alle houten beeld en beeldjes gemaakt, echt heel mooi om te zien hier gebruiken ze echt de handen maar ook de voeten tijdens het houtsnijwerk

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Çok iyi oyma eserler var
text: Magnet ve oyma eserler alınabilir çok sayıda dükkan var. Pazarlık yapmayı unutmayin burda heryerde pazarlık yapın taksilerde dahil

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Good for holiday gifts
text: We love to visit the craft market. Plenty of stalls selling a wide variety of goods to suit any budget. Lots of characters. Don't forget to barter!

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Mooi handwerk
text: Alle beelden en beeldjes worden door de plaatselijke kunstenaars gemaakt  terwijl je op staat te kijken maar het is overal hetzelfde. Ook allerhande mandjes en fruitkorfjes zijn zeer prachtig

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Craft's
text: If you want to take away any local gift's, then this is the place to visit. If they haven't got what you are looking ffor they will make it for you so you could have it the next day an amazing place to try out your haderling skill's.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Heel leuk om even te gaan kijken
text: Het is zeker de moeite waard om even te gaan kijken naar de leuke dingen die ze maken. Ze proberen je uit te leggen, wat en hoe ze het doen en dat is voor de kinderen heel erg leuk.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Worth a Quick Look
text:
Like so many markets around Africa, and the world for that matter, if you have not been to many, this will be something new and exciting even though it is small. If you have travelled extensively, you might find it boring.

I have travelled extensively but surprisingly found it a little interesting. I did not expect to see lots of new and original things I had not seen before, and I did not. It was pleasant though to get some fresh air in a small market that is less crowded and has more open space than most. I hated the fact that people wanted to bargain. I know some people enjoy that but I simply find it a waste of my time. Tell me your best price and I will buy if I like what I hear. Some of the stall owners did not heed this warning from me and lost my business. By the time I got past a few stalls, everyone knew they better just tell me what they really would charge. I ended up buying a small boat and some place mats.

Please do not buy any jewellery that supposedly is made from or has on it crocodile teeth. They sell parts of cow bone and then lie about its origins. When I confronted some of the people about this, one eventually admitted the truth. My taxi driver was also angry with them as he feels that, besides being dishonest, he could be tainted with the same brush just for bringing me to the market.

In conclusion, whether you are an experienced traveller or not, I would say go. Perhaps you see nothing new but at least you will have tried.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: good fun and good value
text:
worth a visit, be prepared to bartar.
don't be pushed to buy, make it clear you want to visit each shop, have a good look and then go back and make your offer

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: colourful
text: Okay for a quick browse,( take a guide with you unless you are firm). You will be hassled and it's the same type of thing, but very lively and colourful

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Lovely..............
text:
The stalls are, almost universally, lovely;  with carvings, cloths and general souvenirs to please and enchant the pickiest tourist, you'll soon find yourself reaching for your wallet.

Don't forget to haggle!

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Nice Handmade things !
text: If you like to collect or fond of collecting handmade or crafty things ..this is is must visit place for you :)

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: i lived in Gambia not holiday maker sorry am biased
text: I loved everything about Gambia the people very friendly must do tours to schools families and Banjul.restaurants very good  Sea Shells ex, also Darbos good music

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: unbeleivable
text: Loved this market, and can only smile about the locals wanting to charge you dalasi for a photograph.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Very talented
text: Sand pictures are excellent and you can order your own designs. A lovely selection of sizes and styles.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Worth a stop
text: Bakau is quite small and has limited tourist attractions but this place and the croc pool make it worth visiting. There are about 15 traders selling a range of local crafts - all very friendly and keen to help. Quality was reasonable and we were able to get a couple of really good deals - bartering is part of the process but good fun. Worth stopping if passing through Bakau.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Good place to shop
text: We have visited the craft market plenty of times. They have a wide selection of handy craft and gifts. If there is something you would like but you can't see they will make it for you. It has a friendly atmosphere and it gives you chance to practice your bartering skills.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: trip with Habaib
text: brilliant, great experience at the market , lovely local crafts to buy . also walk along shores of Gambian river to see fishermen in action . Go with Habaib he will look after you show you things that the main trips perhaps wont

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: Fun to walk around
text: We walked from our hotel to this market area.  It was interesting and easy to walk around with very little hassle.  Had a teak bread board made for us and it was delivered to hotel

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: anexperiace
text: well always go especially if you want to bring anything home be prepard to bargain dont pay any thing less than a third of the price they ask you for if they ask you for an offer go low and work from there if you like you can watch them making the things they sell it is fastinating just watching them i spent many a day watching the make stuff

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop

title: A great place for children and those into arts and crafts.
text:
You could easily walk past this little shop with its corrugated iron walls and roof! It's situated right by the roundabout a Bakau craft market and next door to Saffie j restaurant.
The shop sells sand paintings which are I believe are all crafted on site, it also sells wooden carvings and paintings.
Our daughter first visited last year during a power cut but was invited inside to sit down and have a go at sand art for herself. She spent an hour making a very small picture by torch light.
This year she took lessons during the two weeks we were there. She learned all aspects of sand art and even how to dye the Sand!
She made a lovely picture during the time she spent there and also made a friend in Sheikh who was her teacher and is the son of the owner.
We paid 150 (£3) per hour and while she was busy with the sand we spent the time she was in there watching the world go by from Saffie j next door.
The day before we came home we were each given a bag of gifts by Sheikh and a lovely card. She was also given everything she needs to practice at home (including the different coloured sand hat she had prepared with him).
Please stop and have a look if you're passing this place, the amount of work that goes into these sand paintings is amazing. Have a couple of lessons and learn for yourself how it is done, it's worth every penny.

placeInfo.name: Bakau Craft Market - Sand Art Shop
